CA002.description:
ANAESTHETIST CONSULTATION, professional attendance by an anaesthetist in the practice of ANAESTHESIA 
‐an attendance of 15 minutes or less in duration

CA004.description:
ANAESTHETIST CONSULTATION, professional attendance by an anaesthetist in the practice of ANAESTHESIA 
‐an attendance of more than 15 minutes but not more than 30 minutes in duration

CA006.description:
ANAESTHETIST CONSULTATION, professional attendance by an anaesthetist in the practice of ANAESTHESIA 
‐an attendance of more than 30 minutes but not more than 45 minutes in duration

CA008.description:
ANAESTHETIST CONSULTATION, professional attendance by an anaesthetist in the practice of ANAESTHESIA 
‐an attendance of more than 45 minutes in duration

CA045.description: POST-ANAESTHESIA PATIENT CARE following a DAY PROCEDURE

CA051.description: AFTER-HOURS, professional attendance where the patient's condition requires immediate attendance in the after-hours period, being the period after 6 pm and before 8 am on any weekday, or at any time on a Saturday, a Sunday or a public holiday (no after-hours loading applies to this item) (see page 22-23 for more information)

CA060.description: PROFESSIONAL ATTENDANCE ON A PATIENT IN IMMINENT DANGER OF DEATH requiring continuous lifesaving emergency treatment by an anaesthetist, to the exclusion of all other patients (see page 23 for more information)

CA070.description: CALL-BACK from home, office or other distant location of an anaesthetist for the provision of emergency services. This item is separate from, and additional to, any service provided by the anaesthetist, including consultations (no after-hours loading applies to this item)

CA080.description: ANAESTHESIA CONSULTANCY +T for patient retrievals, hospital inspections, expert opinions and medicolegal work, including review, preparation, attendance, travelling time, writing of reports etc. (no after-hours loading applies to this item) Note: any disbursements for medicolegal work (e.g. accommodation and travel charges) are separate from, and additional to, this item

CA085.description: PATIENT TRANSFER, excluding intra-hospital transfer, where continuous specialist attendance is required

CA086.description: PATIENT TRANSFER, intra-hospital, where continuous specialist attendance is required

CA012.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by VIDEO CONFERENCE, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of 15 minutes or less duration.

CA013.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by VIDEO CONFERENCE, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of more than 15 minutes but no less than 30 minutes duration.

CA014.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by VIDEO CONFERENCE, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of more than 30 minutes but no less than 45 minutes duration.

CA015.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by VIDEO CONFERENCE, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of 45 minutes or more in duration.

CA021.description: Anaesthetist Consultation, professional attendance by telephone, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of 15 minutes or less in duration.

CA022.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by telephone, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of more than 15 minutes but no more than 30 minutes in duration.

CA023.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by telephone, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of more than 30 minutes but no more than 45 minutes in duration.

CA024.description: Anaesthetic Consultation, professional attendance by telephone, by an anaesthetist in the practice of anaesthesia. Attendance of more than 45 minutes in duration.

MBS17610.description:
‐ANAESTHETIST, PRE-ANAESTHESIA CONSULTATION, professional attendance by a medical practitioner in the practice of ANAESTHESIA 
‐a BRIEF consultation involving a targeted history and limited examination (including the cardiorespiratory system) and of not more than 15 minutes duration

MBS17615.description:
‐a consultation on a patient undergoing advanced surgery or who has complex medical problems, involving a selective history and an extensive examination of multiple systems, and the formulation of a written patient management plan documented in the patient notes 
‐ AND of more than 15 minutes but not more than 30 minutes duration

MBS17620.description:
‐a consultation on a patient undergoing advanced surgery or who has complex medical problems, involving a detailed history and comprehensive examination of multiple systems and the formulation of a written patient management plan documented in the patient notes 
‐AND of more than 30 minutes but not more than 45 minutes duration

MBS17625.description: ‐a consultation on a patient undergoing advanced surgery or who has complex medical problems, involving an exhaustive history and comprehensive examination of multiple systems, the formulation of a written patient management plan following discussion with relevant healthcare professionals and/or the patient, involving medical planning of high complexity documented in the patient notes

MBS17640.category: Referred consultations (MBS)—other than prior to anaesthesia
MBS17640.description: ANAESTHETIST CONSULTATION, professional attendance by a specialist anaesthetist in the practice of ANAESTHESIA, where the patient is referred to him or her

MBS17645.category: Referred consultations (MBS)—other than prior to anaesthesia
MBS17645.description:
‐a consultation involving a selective history and examination of multiple systems and the formulation of a written patient management plan 
‐AND of more than 15 minutes but not more than 30 minutes duration

MBS17650.category: Referred consultations (MBS)—other than prior to anaesthesia
MBS17650.description:
‐a consultation involving a detailed history and comprehensive examination of multiple systems and the formulation of a written patient management plan 
‐AND of more than 30 minutes but not more than 45 minutes duration

MBS17655.category: Referred consultations (MBS)—other than prior to anaesthesia
MBS17655.description:
‐a consultation involving an exhaustive history and comprehensive examination of multiple systems and the formulation of a written patient management plan following discussion with relevant healthcare professionals and/or the patient, involving medical planning of high complexity 
‐AND of more than 45 minutes duration

MBS17680.description: ‐a consultation immediately prior to the institution of a major regional blockade in a patient in labour, where no previous anaesthesia consultation has occurred

M3.description: Anaesthesia in the prone position (not applicable to Item CG810)

CS965.description:
ANAESTHESIA as a therapeutic procedure where it can be demonstrated that there is 
a clinical need for anaesthesia 
The MBS states 'not for headache of any etiology'

CS969.description:
ANAESTHESIA during hyperbaric therapy where the medical practitioner is not 
confined in the chamber (including the administration of oxygen)

CS970.description:
‐hyperbaric therapy where the medical practitioner is confined in the chamber 
(including the administration of oxygen)

CU999.description:
UNLISTED ANAESTHESIA - PROCEDURE(S). The ASA recognises 
that in determining the number of units applicable, the anaesthetist shall have 
regard to equivalent procedures

CV056.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV056.description:
Intraoperative two-dimensional or three-dimensional real time TRANSOESOPHAGEAL 
ECHOCARDIOGRAPHY by an anaesthetist, where the service: 
(a)includes Doppler techniques with colour flow mapping and recordings on digital media; 
and 
(b)is performed during cardiac valve surgery (replacement or repair); and 
(c)incorporates sequential assessment of cardiac function and valve competence before 
and after the surgical procedure; and 
(d) is not associated with a service to which item CS936, CV060, CV070, CV730 or CV740 
applies; and 
(e)is provided on the same occasion as the administration of anaesthesia by the same 
anaesthetist

CV730.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV730.description:
HEART, TWO-DIMENSIONAL REAL-TIME TRANSOESOPHAGEAL EXAMINATION 
of at least two oesophageal windows performed using a mechanical sector 
scanner or phased array transducer with: 
a) measurement of blood-flow velocities across the cardiac valves using 
pulsed wave and continuous Doppler techniques, 
b) real-time colour flow mapping from at least two oesophageal windows, and 
c) recording on video tape or digital medium

CV740.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV740.description:
INTRAOPERATIVE TWO-DIMENSIONAL REAL-TIME TRANSOESOPHAGEAL 
ECHOCARDIOGRAPHY incorporating Doppler techniques with colour flow 
mapping and recording onto video tape or digital medium, performed during 
cardiac surgery incorporating sequential assessment of cardiac function before 
and after the surgical procedure*

CV120.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV120.description:
INTRATHECAL, COMBINED SPINAL-EPIDURAL or EPIDURAL 
INJECTION (initial or commencement of infusion) of a therapeutic substance, 
including up to one hour of continuous attendance by the medical practitioner, 
not in association with anaesthesia and surgery*

CV122.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV122.description:
INTRATHECAL, COMBINED SPINAL-EPIDURAL or EPIDURAL INJECTION 
(initial or commencement of infusion) of a therapeutic substance, where continuous 
attendance by the medical practitioner extends beyond the first hour* 
DERIVED FEE being 8 units for the first hour (as for Item CV120) plus 1 unit for each 
additional 15 minutes or part thereof

mbs_items.fee: The fee for Item 18216 ($221.55) plus $21.65 for each additional 15 minutes after 1 hour

CV123.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV123.description:
INTRATHECAL, COMBINED SPINAL-EPIDURAL or EPIDURAL INJECTION 
(initial or commencement of infusion) of a therapeutic substance, including up to 
one hour of continuous attendance by the medical practitioner AFTER-HOURS (see 
page 13 for definition), for a patient in labour, not in association with anaesthesia 
and surgery*

CV124.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV124.description:
INTRATHECAL, COMBINED SPINAL-EPIDURAL or EPIDURAL INJECTION 
(initial or commencement of infusion) of a therapeutic substance where continuous 
AFTER-HOURS attendance by the medical practitioner extends beyond the first hour, 
for a patient in labour*. 
DERIVED FEE being 15 units for the first hour (as for Item CV123) plus 1 unit for 
each additional 15 minutes or part thereof

mbs_items.fee: The fee for item 18226 ($332.25) plus $32.60 for each additional 15 minutes after 1 hour

CV125.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV125.description:
Continuous infusion or injection by catheter of a therapeutic substance (not contrast 
agent) to maintain regional anaesthesia or analgesia, subsequent injection or revision 
of, if the period of continuous medical practitioner attendance is 15 minutes 
or less*

CV126.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV126.description:
Continuous infusion or injection by catheter of a therapeutic substance (not contrast 
agent) to maintain regional anaesthesia or analgesia, subsequent injection or revision 
of, if the period of continuous medical practitioner attendance is more than 
15 minutes*

CV140.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV140.description:
INTRATHECAL, EPIDURAL or CAUDAL injection of a substance other than 
anaesthetic, contrast or neurolytic solutions, not being a service to which 
another item in this group applies

CV145.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV145.description: EPIDURAL INJECTION of blood for blood patch

CV155.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV155.description:
Assistance at the administration of an epidural blood patch (a service to which 
item CV145/18233 applies) by another practitioner

CV081.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV081.description:
MAJOR NERVE BLOCK (proximal to the elbow or knee), including intercostal nerve 
block(s) or plexus block (specify type) to provide postoperative pain relief (not to be 
used in conjunction with items CV082 or CV083, or any item in the range CV200 to 
CV330)**

CV082.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV082.description:
MINOR NERVE BLOCK (specify type) to provide postoperative pain relief (this does 
not include subcutaneous infiltration) (not to be used in conjunction with items CV081 
or CV083, or any item in the range CV200 to CV330)**

CV083.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV083.description:
MAJOR PERIPHERAL NERVE BLOCK, performed perioperatively, with the 
introduction of a catheter to allow continuous nerve blockade, to provide postoperative pain 
relief (not to be used in conjunction with items CV081 or CV082, or any item in the range 
CV200 to CV330)

CV084.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV084.description:
Introduction of a nerve block performed via retrobulbar, peribulbar or sub-Tenon's 
approach, or other complex eye block, when administered by an anaesthetist 
perioperatively*

CV085.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV085.description:
INTRATHECAL or EPIDURAL INJECTION (initial) of a therapeutic substance or 
substances, with or without insertion of a catheter, in association with anaesthesia and 
surgery, for postoperative pain management**

CV086.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV086.description:
INTRATHECAL or EPIDURAL INJECTION (subsequent) of a therapeutic substance 
or substances, using an in situ catheter, in association with anaesthesia and surgery, for 
postoperative pain relief (not to be used in conjunction with Item CV085)**

CV130.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV130.description:
INTRATHECAL, EPIDURAL or CAUDAL INJECTION of a neurolytic substance (not 
contrast agent) by any route, including transforaminal route

CV400.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV400.description:
TRIGEMINAL NERVE, supraorbital, infraorbital, mental or inferior alveolar 
branch, destruction by a neurolytic agent

CV405.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV405.description:
TRIGEMINAL NERVE, second and third division branches at foramen ovale, 
destruction by a neurolytic agent

CV415.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV415.description:
CRANIAL NERVE OTHER THAN TRIGEMINAL, destruction by a 
neurolytic agent, not being a service associated with the injection of 
botulinum toxin (Anaesthesia)

CV420.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV420.description:
NERVE BRANCH, not covered by any other item in this group, destruction 
by a neurolytic agent, not being a service associated with the injection of 
botulinum toxin (Anaesthesia)

CV430.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV430.description:
COELIAC PLEXUS or SPLANCHNIC NERVES, destruction by a neurolytic 
agent under image guidance

CV440.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV440.description:
LUMBAR OR PELVIC SYMPATHETIC CHAIN, destruction by a neurolytic 
agent under image guidance

CV450.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV450.description:
CERVICAL or THORACIC SYMPATHETIC CHAIN, destruction by a 
neurolytic agent

CV700.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV700.description: HYPERBARIC OXYGEN TREATMENT when the specialist is inside the chamber

CV710.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV710.description:
HYPERBARIC OXYGEN TREATMENT when the specialist is outside the 
chamber

CV052.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV052.description:
INTRAVENOUS REGIONAL ANAESTHESIA OF LIMB BY 
RETROGRADE PERFUSION

CV200.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV200.description:
INJECTION OF AN ANAESTHETIC AGENT in the trigeminal nerve, primary 
division of (not in association with a service to which another item in that 
group maybe applied, unless a targeted percutaneous technique is used)

CV225.description:
‐ilioinguinal, iliohypogastric, or genitofemoral nerves, one or more of, 
or transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block

CV230.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV233.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV233.description:
‐ulnar, radial or median nerve of main trunk, one or more of, not being 
associated with a brachial plexus block

CV239.description: ‐saphenous, sural, popliteal or posterior tibial nerve of main trunk, one or more of

CV240.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV240.description:
‐paravertebral, cervical, thoracic, lumbar, sacral or coccygeal nerves, single 
vertebral level

CV241.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV245.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV250.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV305.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV308.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV308.description: ‐carotid sinus, as an independent percutaneous procedure

CV310.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV320.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV330.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV055.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV060.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV060.description:
MEDICAL MANAGEMENT OF CARDIOPULMONARY BYPASS PERFUSION 
using heart/lung machine or equivalent

CV065.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV070.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV070.description:
CARDIOPLAEGIA, BLOOD OR CRYSTALLOID, administration by any 
route

CV075.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV075.description:
DEEP HYPOTHERMIA to a core temperature of less than 22 degrees 
in association with circulatory arrest, including management of retrograde 
cerebral perfusion if performed

CV076.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV076.description:
STANDBY MEDICAL MANAGEMENT OF CARDIOPULMONARY BYPASS 
PERFUSION using heart/lung machine or equivalent

CV014.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV014.description:
Monitoring that: 
(a) is of one of the following types of blood pressure: 
(i) central venous blood pressure; 
(ii) pulmonary arterial blood pressure; 
(iii) systemic arterial blood pressure; 
(iv) cardiac intracavity blood pressure; and 
(b) is conducted by indwelling catheter; and 
(c) is performed in association with the administration of anaesthesia for a 
procedure and not as a service to which item BM025/13876 applies; 
and 
(d) is performed, on a day, on a patient who: 
(i) is categorised as having a high risk of complications; or 
(ii) during the procedure develops either complications or a high 
risk of complications; and 
(e) has not previously been performed in those circumstances on the day 
on the patient for that type of blood pressure

CV015.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV015.description:
RIGHT HEART BALLOON CATHETER, insertion of, including pulmonary 
wedge pressure and cardiac output measurement, when performed in 
association with the administration of anaesthesia

CV026.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV026.description: ARTERIAL PUNCTURE, withdrawal of blood for diagnosis

CV010.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV010.description:
VENOUS CANNULATION and commencement of intravenous 
infusion, under three years of age, not associated with anaesthesia

CV011.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV013.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV013.description:
VENOUS CANNULATION and commencement of intravenous 
infusion not associated with anaesthesia

CV020.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV020.description:
CENTRAL VEIN CATHETERISATION, percutaneous, performed in 
association with the administration of anaesthesia

CV022.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV025.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV025.description:
Intra-arterial cannulation when performed in association with the 
management of anaesthesia for a procedure for a patient who: 
(a) is categorised as having a high risk of complications; or 
(b) develops a high risk of complications during the 
procedure.

CV027.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV029.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV029.description:
CATHETERISATION, UMBILICAL ARTERY, newborn, for diagnosis or 
therapy

CV035.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV035.description:
PLACEMENT OF A PERIPHERALLY INSERTED CENTRAL CATHETER 
(PICC) for the purpose of long-term vascular access, including up to 1 
hour of procedure time

CV036.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV036.description:
PLACEMENT OF A PERIPHERALLY INSERTED CENTRAL CATHETER 
(PICC) for the purpose of long-term vascular access, including up to 1 
hour of procedure time 
DERIVED FEE being 8 units for the first hour (as for Item CV035) plus 1 
unit for each additional 15 minutes or part thereof

CV005.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV005.description:
ENDOTRACHEAL INTUBATION, emergency procedure, when the 
patient's airway is unsecured and at high risk of occlusion (e.g. epiglottitis 
or haematoma post thyroidectomy), not associated with surgery. If 
associated with surgery refer to Item CB305 on page 48

CV006.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV006.description:
ENDOTRACHEAL INTUBATION, not associated with anaesthesia, when 
subsequent management is not in an intensive care unit

CV007.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV007.description:
ENDOTRACHEAL INTUBATION with flexible fibreoptic scope, associated 
with difficult airway, when performed in association with the administration 
of anaesthesia

CV008.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV008.description:
DOUBLE LUMEN ENDOBRONCHIAL TUBE OR BRONCHIAL BLOCKER, insertion of, 
when performed in association with the administration of anaesthesia

CV600.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV600.description:
ENDOTRACHEAL EXTUBATION of a patientwith a known difficult airway or at risk of 
airway compromise. Not in association with surgery

CV040.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV040.description:
TRANSFUSION OF BLOOD by an anaesthetist, including collection from 
donor, when used for intra-operative normovolaemic haemodilution, where the 
service is provided on the same occasion as the administration of anaesthesia by 
the same anaesthetist

CV001.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV001.description:
COLLECTION OF BLOOD FOR AUTOLOGOUS TRANSFUSION (including 
collection by intra-operative cell saver in non-cardiac surgery) when performed 
in association with the administration of anaesthesia. CV001 cannot be used in 
conjunction with CV040

CV002.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV002.description:
Administration of blood or bone marrow, when performed in association with the 
management of anaesthesia

CV003.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV003.description:
VENOUS CANNULATION and BLOOD TRANSFUSION (or blood products) not 
associated with anaesthesia

CV004.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV004.description:
ADMINISTRATION OF MASSIVE BLOOD TRANSFUSION in association with the 
administration of anaesthesia ("massive" is defined as being the replacement of at 
least one whole blood volume of the patient within a 24-hour period)

CV800.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV800.description:
The use of two-dimensional ULTRASOUND GUIDANCE to assist percutaneous major 
vascular access (including arterial access and the insertion of peripherally inserted 
central catheter) (Note: this item may be used in addition to the relevant item for 
vascular catheterisation)*

CV805.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV805.description:
The use of two-dimensional ULTRASOUND GUIDANCE to assist 
percutaneous neural blockade (Note: this item may be used in 
addition to the relevant nerve block item)*

CV009.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV009.description:
MONITORING DEPTH OF ANAESTHESIA, incorporating 
continuous measurement of the electroencephalogram during 
anaesthesia for the diagnosis of awareness, in situations with a higher 
baseline risk of awareness**

CV032.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV032.description:
INTRA-ARTERIAL INFUSION or retrograde intravenous perfusion of a 
sympatholytic agent

CV053.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV053.description:
INSERTION OF LUMBAR CEREBROSPINAL FLUID DRAIN, when 
performed in association with the administration of anaesthesia

CV100.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV105.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services

CV128.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV128.description:
INTERPLEURAL BLOCK, initial injection or commencement of infusion of 
a therapeutic substance, not in association with a service to which 
an item in Group T8 applies, unless the nerve block is performed using a 
targeted percutaneous approach

CV500.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV500.description: CARDIOVERSION, elective, electrical conversion of arrhythmia, external

CV9814.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV9814.description:
ANAESTHETIC AGENT ALLERGY TESTING, using skin sensitivity 
methods in a patient with a history of prior anaphylactic or anaphylactoid 
reaction or cardiovascular collapse in association with the administration of 
anaesthesia agents

CV999.category: Division V: Therapeutic and diagnostic services
CV999.description: Unlisted special service—please see CU999 (see page 77)

BL600.description:
CENTRAL VEIN CATHETERISATION by percutaneous or open exposure, 
not being a service to which Item BH750 applies 
Item BH750—(equivalent MBS Item 13318) applies to catheterisation by 
open exposure, in a paediatric patient

BL610.description:
RIGHT HEART BALLOON CATHETER, insertion of, including pulmonary 
wedge pressure and cardiac output measurement

BL620.description:
INTRACRANIAL PRESSURE, monitoring of, by intraventricular 
or subdural catheter, subarachnoid bolt or similar, by a specialist or 
consultant physician, each day (no after-hours loading applies to this 
item)

BL622.description:
Peripheral cannulation, including under ultrasound guidance where 
clinically appropriate, for veno-arterial cardiopulmonary extracorporeal life 
support. No separate ultrasound item is payable with this item

BL624.description:
Veno-arterial extracorporeal life support, management of – the first 
day

BL625.description:
Veno-arterial extracorporeal life support, management of – each day 
after the first

BL627.description:
Veno-venous pulmonary extracorporeal life support, 
management of – the first day

BL628.description:
Veno-venous pulmonary extracorporeal life support, 
management of – each day after the first

BL630.description: ARTERIAL PUNCTURE and collection of blood for diagnostic purposes

BL631.description:
Peripheral cannulation, including under ultrasound guidance where 
clinically appropriate, for venovenous pulmonary extracorporeal life 
support. No separate ultrasound item is payable with this item

BL640.description:
INTRA-ARTERIAL CANNULATION, including under ultrasound guidance 
where clinically appropriate, for the purpose of intra-arterial pressure 
monitoring or arterial blood sampling (or both). No separate ultrasound 
item is payable with this item

BL660.description:
COUNTERPULSATION BY INTRAAORTIC BALLOON, management 
– including associated consultations and monitoring of parameters 
by means of full haemodynamic assessment and management on 
several occasions on a day – each day

BL670.description:
VENTRICULAR ASSIST DEVICE, management of, for a patient 
admitted to an intensive care unit, including management 
of complications arising from implantation or management of the 
device

BL680.description:
VENTRICULAR ASSIST DEVICE, management of, for a patient 
admitted to an intensive care unit, including management 
of complications arising from implantation or management of the 
device – each day after the first day

BL690.description:
AIRWAY ACCESS, establishment of, and initiation of mechanical 
ventilation (other than in the context of an anaesthetic for surgery), 
outside an intensive care unit, for the purpose of subsequent ventilatory 
support in an intensive care unit

BM005.description:
MANAGEMENT of a patient in an intensive care unit by a specialist 
or consultant physician who is immediately available and 
exclusively rostered for intensive care, including initial and subsequent 
attendances, electrocardiographic monitoring, arterial sampling 
and bladder catheterisation—management on the first day

BM015.description:
MANAGEMENT of a patient in an intensive care unit by a specialist 
or consultant physician who is immediately available and 
exclusively rostered for intensive care, including all attendances, 
electrocardiographic monitoring, arterial sampling and bladder 
catheterisation—management on each day subsequent to the first day 
(no after-hours loading applies to this item)

BM025.description:
CENTRAL VENOUS PRESSURE, pulmonary arterial pressure, 
systemic arterial pressure or cardiac intracavity pressure, continuous 
monitoring by indwelling catheter in an intensive care unit, by a 
specialist or consultant physician who is immediately available and 
exclusively rostered for intensive care—each day of monitoring for 
each pressure up to a maximum of four pressures (no after-hours 
loading applies to this item)

BM040.description:
AIRWAY ACCESS, establishment of, and initiation of mechanical 
ventilation, in an intensive care unit, not in association with 
any anaesthetic service, by a specialist or consultant physician, 
for the purpose of subsequent ventilatory support

BM045.description:
VENTILATORY SUPPORT, in an intensive care unit, by invasive 
means or by non-invasive means where the only alternative to 
non-invasive ventilatory support would be invasive ventilatory 
support, management by a specialist or consultant physician 
who is immediately available and exclusively rostered for intensive 
care—each day (no after-hours loading applies to this item)

BM055.description:
CONTINUOUS ARTERIOVENOUS OR VENO-VENOUS 
HAEMOFILTRATION, in an intensive care unit, management by a 
specialist or consultant physician who is immediately available and 
exclusively rostered for intensive care—on the first day

BM065.description:
CONTINUOUS ARTERIOVENOUS OR VENO-VENOUS 
HAEMOFILTRATION, in an intensive care unit, management by a 
specialist or consultant physician who is immediately available and 
exclusively rostered for intensive care—on each day subsequent to 
the first day (no after-hours loading applies to this item)

BM070.description:
PROFESSIONAL ATTENDANCE, OUTSIDE AN INTENSIVE CARE 
UNIT, for at least 60 minutes spent in preparation of goals of care, by a 
specialist in the specialty of intensive care who takes overall responsibility 
for the preparation of the goals of care for the patient*

AF010.description:
PROFESSIONAL ATTENDANCE at consulting rooms or hospital by a 
consultant physician or specialist practising in the specialty of pain 
medicine, where the patient was referred to him or her by a medical 
practitioner

AF040.description:
PROFESSIONAL ATTENDANCE at a place other than consulting 
rooms or hospital by a consultant physician or specialist practising 
in the specialty of pain medicine, where the patient was referred to 
him or her by a medical practitioner

BM960.description:
IMPLANTED INFUSION PUMP REFILLING OF RESERVOIR, with a therapeutic agent or agents, 
for infusion to the subarachnoid or epidural space, with or without reprogramming of a 
programmable pump, for the management of chronic intractable pain

BM970.description:
LONG-TERM IMPLANTED DEVICE for delivery of therapeutic agents, accessing of, not being a 
service associated with a service to which Item BM500 applies (Item BM500 (MBS Item 13945) 
refers to the accessing of an implanted device for the delivery of a cytotoxic chemotherapeutic 
agent)

LN045.description:
Injection of one or more zygo-apophyseal or costo-transverse joints with one or more 
of contrast media, local anaesthetic or corticosteroid under image guidance

LN050.description:
The injection of an anaesthetic agent into the medial branch block of one or more primary 
posterior rami. The item will differentiate a medical branch block (as a prelude to 
radiofrequency neurotomy) from an intra-articular zygaphophyseal joint block (MBS item 
39013 / AMA item LN045).

LN410.description:
INJECTION OF PRIMARY BRANCH OF TRIGEMINAL NERVE (ophthalmic, maxillary or 
mandibular branches) with alcohol, cortisone, phenol, or similar neurolytic substance, under 
image guidance

LN420.description: INTRATHECAL INJECTION of alcohol or phenol

LN440.description:
TRIGEMINAL GANGLIOTOMY by radiofrequency, balloon or glycerol, including 
stereotaxy

LN445.description:
Left lumbar percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe, or 
cryoprobe, using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12-month period

LN448.description:
Right lumbar percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe, or 
cryoprobe, using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12-month period

LN464.description:
Left thoracic percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe or 
cryoprobe using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12-month period

LN468.description:
Right thoracic percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe, or 
cryoprobe, using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12-month period

LN470.description:
Left cervical percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe, or 
cryoprobe, using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12 month period

LN472.description:
Right cervical percutaneous zygapophyseal joint denervation by radio-frequency probe, or 
cryoprobe, using radiological imaging control. Applicable to one or more services provided 
in a single attendance, for not more than 3 attendances in a 12-month period

LN500.description:
Intrathecal or epidural SPINAL CATHETER, insertion or replacement of, and connection to a 
subcutaneous implanted infusion pump, for the management of chronic intractable pain

LN510.description:
INFUSION PUMP, subcutaneous implantation or replacement of, and connection of the pump 
to an intrathecal or epidural catheter, and filling of reservoir with a therapeutic agent or agents, 
with or without programming the pump, for the management of chronic intractable pain

LN530.description:
INFUSION PUMP, subcutaneous implantation of, AND intrathecal or epidural SPINAL 
CATHETER, insertion of, and connection of pump to catheter and filling of reservoir with 
a therapeutic agent or agents, with or without programming of the pump, for the management 
of chronic intractable pain

LN535.description:
Peripheral lead or leads, percutaneous placement of, including intraoperative test 
stimulation, for the management of chronic neuropathic pain

LN540.description:
EPIDURAL LEAD, percutaneous placement of, including intraoperative test stimulation, for the 
management of chronic intractable neuropathic pain from refractory angina pectoris, to a 
maximum of four leads

LN550.description:
ELECTRODES, epidural or peripheral nerve, management of patient and adjustment or 
reprogramming of neurostimulator by a medical practitioner, for the management of chronic 
intractable neuropathic pain or pain from refractory angina pectoris—each day

LN560.description:
REMOVAL of subcutaneously IMPLANTED INFUSION PUMP or removal or repositioning of 
intrathecal or epidural SPINAL CATHETER for the management of chronic intractable pain

LN570.description:
NEUROSTIMULATOR or RECEIVER, subcutaneous placement of, including 
placement and connection of extension wires to epidural or peripheral nerve electrodes, for the 
management of chronic intractable neuropathic pain or pain from refractory angina pectoris

LN575.description:
NEUROSTIMULATOR or RECEIVER, that was inserted for the management of chronic 
intractable neuropathic pain or pain from refractory angina pectoris, removal of, 
performed in the operating theatre of a hospital

LN580.description:
LEAD, epidural or peripheral nerve that was inserted for the management of chronic 
intractable neuropathic pain or pain from refractory angina pectoris, removal of, 
performed in the operating theatre of a hospital

LN583.description:
LEAD, epidural or peripheral nerve, that was inserted for the management of chronic 
intractable neuropathic pain or pain from refractory angina pectoris, surgical repositioning 
to correct displacement or unsatisfactory positioning, including intraoperative test 
stimulation, not being a service to which LN540, LN587 or LN590 applies 
(Item LN590 (MBS Item 39139) refers to a surgical procedure involving laminectomy)

LN587.description:
PERIPHERAL NERVE LEAD, surgical placement of, including intraoperative test 
stimulation, for the management of chronic intractable neuropathic pain or pain from 
refractory angina pectoris, to a maximum of four leads

LN600.description:
EPIDURAL CATHETER, insertion of, under imaging control, with epidurogram and 
epidural therapeutic injection for lysis of adhesions

AF070.description:
Attendance by a consultant physician or specialist practising in the specialty of 
pain medicine, as a member of a case conference team, TO ORGANISE AND 
COORDINATE A COMMUNITY CASE CONFERENCE, with a multidisciplinary 
team of at least three other formal care providers of different disciplines 
‐where the conference time is at least 15 minutes, but less than 30 minutes

AF080.description: ‐where the conference time is at least 30 minutes, but less than 45 minutes

AF090.description: ‐where the conference time is at least 45 minutes

AF100.description:
Attendance by a consultant physician or specialist practising in the specialty of 
pain medicine, as a member of a case conference team, TO PARTICIPATE IN 
A COMMUNITY CASE CONFERENCE (other than to organise and to coordinate 
the conference) with a multidisciplinary team of at least two other formal care 
providers of different disciplines 
‐where the conference time is at least 15 minutes, but less than 30 minutes

AF110.description: ‐where the conference time is at least 30 minutes, but less than 45 minutes

AF120.description: ‐where the conference time is at least 45 minutes

the speciality of pain medicine, as a member of a case conference team, 
TO ORGANISE AND COORDINATE A DISCHARGE CASE CONFERENCE 
with a multidisciplinary team of at least three other formal care 
providers of different disciplines 
‐where the conference time is at least 15 minutes, but less than 30 
minutes

AF140.description:
‐where the conference time is at least 30 minutes, but less than 45 
minutes

AF150.description: ‐where the conference time is at least 45 minutes

AF160.description:
Attendance by a consultant physician or specialist practising in 
the speciality of pain medicine, as a member of a case conference team, 
TO PARTICIPATE IN A DISCHARGE CASE CONFERENCE with a 
multidisciplinary team of at least two other formal care providers of 
different disciplines 
‐where the conference time is at least 15 minutes, but less than 30
